oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pioneer Rhythm Boys - WHFB - 1950-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pioneer Rhythm Boys radio show for station WHFB, Benton Harbor, MI. Originally broadcast in May of 1950 [unconfirmed] at 11:30 am. Featuring Mel Irving (announcer), Eddie Skates (host), and (verbally identified) band members Butch, Ray 'The Professor' Watkins, and Rex Watkins. Sponsored by Bill's Auto Service and Al's Grocery. Tape also contains recordings of various performances by the Pioneer Rhythm Boys (performers), Bob Little (performer), the Tennessee Ramblers (performer), and other unidentified performers, all on various dates.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pioneer Rhythm Boys; Tennessee Ramblers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Theme -- Opening statement (Mel Irving) -- Opening statement (Eddie Skates) -- Candy Kisses (Butch) -- Bill's Auto Service commercial (Mel Irving) -- Eddie Skates introduces the next tune and -- Call Me Babe (Rex Watkins) -- Eddie Skates introduces Ray Watkins and the next tune -- Wildwood Flower (Ray Watkins) -- Al's Grocery store commercial (Mel Irving) -- Eddie Skates introduces the Rex and the next tune -- Someday You'll Call My Name (Rex Watkins) -- Eddie Skates introduces Butch and the next tune -- I'm Throwing Rice (Butch) -- Closing statement (Eddie Skates) -- Theme -- [break] -- Give A Little Love (Bob Little) -- Soft Lips (Curly) -- Sugarfoot Rag (Pioneer Rhythm Boys) -- Eddie Skates talks about a future show -- Bill's Auto Service and Ray's Auto Parts commercial -- May You Never Be Alone Like Me (Pioneer Rhythm Boys) -- Hilo March (Tennessee Ramblers) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- Golden Treasures (Pioneer Rhythm Boys) -- Al's Grocery and Bill's Auto Service commercial (incomplete) -- Cry Baby Heart (Pioneer Rhythm Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WHFB (Radio station : Benton Harbor, Mich.); Pioneer Rhythm Boys;
